content.text:
# Austin Film Critics Association Awards 2018

The 14th Austin Film Critics Association Awards, honoring the best in filmmaking for 2018, were announced on January 7, 2019. The nominees were announced on December 27, 2018.
Winners and nominees
{| class=wikitable style="width=100%"
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Film
!style="width=50%"|Best Director
|-
| valign="top" |
# If Beale Street Could Talk
# The Favourite
# Roma
# Blindspotting
# You Were Never Really Here
# Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
# First Reformed
# Eighth Grade
# Shoplifters
# Suspiria
| valign="top" |
* 'Barry Jenkins – If Beale Street Could Talk'
** Alfonso Cuarón – Roma
** Debra Granik – Leave No Trace
** Yorgos Lanthimos – The Favourite
** Lynne Ramsay – You Were Never Really Here
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Actor
!style="width=50%"|Best Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Ethan Hawke – First Reformed'
** Christian Bale – Vice
** Bradley Cooper – A Star Is Born
** Rami Malek – Bohemian Rhapsody
** Joaquin Phoenix – You Were Never Really Here
| valign="top" |
* 'Olivia Colman – The Favourite'
** Toni Collette – Hereditary
** Elsie Fisher – Eighth Grade
** Regina Hall – Support the Girls
** Melissa McCarthy – Can You Ever Forgive Me?
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Supporting Actor
!style="width=50%"|Best Supporting Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Richard E. Grant – Can You Ever Forgive Me?'
** Hugh Grant – Paddington 2
** Michael B. Jordan – Black Panther
** Brian Tyree Henry – If Beale Street Could Talk
** Steven Yeun – Burning
| valign="top" |
* 'Regina King – If Beale Street Could Talk'
** Amy Adams – Vice
** Claire Foy – First Man
** Emma Stone – The Favourite
** Rachel Weisz – The Favourite
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Original Screenplay
!style="width=50%"|Best Adapted Screenplay
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Sorry to Bother You – Boots Riley'
** Eighth Grade – Bo Burnham
** The Favourite – Deborah Davis and Tony McNamara
** First Reformed – Paul Schrader
** Roma – Alfonso Cuarón
| valign="top" |
* 'If Beale Street Could Talk – Barry Jenkins'
** BlacKkKlansman – Charlie Wachtel, David Rabinowitz, Kevin Willmott and Spike Lee
** Can You Ever Forgive Me? – Nicole Holofcener and Jeff Whitty
** The Death of Stalin – Armando Iannucci, David Schneider and Ian Martin
** Leave No Trace – Debra Granik and Anne Rosellini
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Film Editing
!style="width=50%"|Best Ensemble
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'First Man - Tom Cross'
** If Beale Street Could Talk - Joi McMillon and Nat Sanders
** Roma - Alfonso Cuarón and Adam Gough
** The Favourite – Yorgos Mavropsaridis
** Widows – Joe Walker
| valign="top" |
* Widows
** Avengers: Infinity War
** Black Panther
** Crazy Rich Asians
** The Favourite
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Animated Film
!style="width=50%"|Best Foreign Language Film
|-
| valign="top" |
* Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse
** Incredibles 2
** Isle of Dogs
** Mirai
** Ralph Breaks the Internet
| valign="top" |
* Burning
** Cold War
** The Guilty
** Roma
** Shoplifters
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best First Film
!style="width=50%"|Best Documentary
|-
| valign="top" |
* Eighth Grade
** Hereditary
** A Star Is Born
** Blindspotting
** Sorry to Bother You
| valign="top" |
* 'Won't You Be My Neighbor?'
** Free Solo
** Minding the Gap
** RBG
** Shirkers
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Cinematography
!style="width=50%"|Best Score
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Roma – Alfonso Cuarón'
** Burning – Hong Kyung-pyo
** First Man – Linus Sandgren
** If Beale Street Could Talk – James Laxton
** Widows – Sean Bobbitt
| valign="top" |
* 'Mandy – Jóhann Jóhannsson'
** Annihilation – Ben Salisbury and Geoff Barrow
** First Man – Justin Hurwitz
** If Beale Street Could Talk – Nicholas Britell
** Suspiria – Thom Yorke
|-
!style="width=50%"|Best Stunts
!style="width=50%"|Best Motion Capture/Special Effects Performance
|-
| valign="top" |
* Mission: Impossible – Fallout
** Black Panther
** Mandy
** The Night Comes for Us
** Upgrade
| valign="top" |
* 'Josh Brolin - Avengers: Infinity War'
** Shameik Moore - Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse
** Sonoya Mizuno - Annihilation
** Phoebe Waller-Bridge - Solo: A Star Wars Story
** Ben Whishaw - Paddington 2
|-
!style="width=50%"|Bobby McCurdy Memorial Breakthrough Artist Award
!style="width=50%"|Austin Film Award
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Brian Tyree Henry – If Beale Street Could Talk, Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse and Widows'
** Yalitza Aparicio – Roma
** Jim Cummings – Thunder Road
** Elsie Fisher – Eighth Grade
** Boots Riley – Sorry to Bother You
| valign="top" |
* 'Support the Girls – Andrew Bujalski'
** 1985 – Yen Tan
** Call Her Ganda – PJ Raval
** Damsel – David Zellner and Nathan Zellner
** Run Like the Devil – Steve Mims
|-
! colspan="2" | Special Honorary Award
|-
| colspan=2 valign="top" width="50%"|
* To Bo Burnham, Elsie Fisher, Josh Hamilton for their brilliant collaborative work on Eighth Grade.
|}
